critique: This document is an executive order from 1939 that exempts certain positions from a previous executive order. It pertains to consultants, experts, specialists, attorneys, and other similar positions intermittently employed on a per diem or annual basis and paid from public works or other emergency funds administered by the Federal Works Administrator. Given the context of the time (the New Deal era), this likely involves government intervention in the economy to address the Great Depression. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power changes, federalism implications, national security vs. civil liberties concerns, or social inclusion aspects. The primary focus seems to be on the economic regulation aspect, specifically related to public works and emergency funds.
